tool_description: Analyzes historical stock movement patterns to identify trends, anomalies, and provide insights for inventory optimization.

start_date.description: Start date for analysis period in ISO 8601 format

end_date.description: End date for analysis period in ISO 8601 format

analysis_type.description: Type of analysis: trend, velocity, anomaly, pattern, forecast

location_filter.description: Array of location IDs to include in analysis

item_category_filter.description: Array of item categories to include

movement_type_filter.description: Array of movement types to analyze

grouping_period.description: Time period for grouping data: daily, weekly, monthly

min_movement_threshold.description: Minimum movement quantity to include in analysis

anomaly_sensitivity.description: Sensitivity for anomaly detection (1.0-5.0, higher = more sensitive)

include_seasonality.description: Whether to account for seasonal patterns

forecast_periods.description: Number of future periods to forecast (only for forecast analysis)

error_messages: Invalid date range: Start date must be before end date and both must be in the past
Invalid analysis type: Must be one of [trend, velocity, anomaly, pattern, forecast]
Date range too large: Analysis period cannot exceed 2 years
Insufficient data: Not enough movement data found for meaningful analysis
Invalid sensitivity: Anomaly sensitivity must be between 1.0 and 5.0
Invalid grouping period: Must be one of [daily, weekly, monthly]
Location not found: One or more locations in filter do not exist
usage: Provide start_date, end_date, and analysis_type. Use filters to narrow scope and configure analysis parameters like grouping_period, sensitivity, and forecast_periods.

trend_direction.description: Overall trend direction: increasing, decreasing, stable

key_metrics.description: Array of key metrics in format 'metric_name:value'

anomalies_detected.description: Number of anomalies detected in the analysis period

recommendations.description: Array of actionable recommendations based on analysis
